p: Immune cell infiltration and cytokine production were observed in the mouse CNS after infection by HCoV-OC43. This immune response was significantly increased after infection by viral variants, which harbor mutations in the viral glycoprotein (S) [ 267]. These variants also induced glutamate excitotoxicity [ 268, 289], thus increasing damage to neurons [ 310] and/or disturbing glutamate homeostasis [ 311] and thereby contributing to neuronal degeneration and hind-limb paralysis and possible demyelination [ 266, 267, 268, 269]. The degeneration of neurons may eventually lead to death of these essential cells by directly generating a cytotoxic insult related to viral replication and/or to the induction of different regulated cell death (RCD) pathways [ 312, 313, 314]. Our results indicate that the underlying mechanisms appear to involve different cellular factors and pathways of RCD, described and reviewed elsewhere [ 38, 315].
